data.title: ISTG Vol 18
data.text:
Columns represent: given name, surname, age, sex, occupation, the country to which they severally belong, the country of which they intend to become inhabitants, and the compartment occupied during the voyage.

States Steerage 131 Adalbert Klein 24 M Merchant Königsberg U. States Steerage (Signature) W H Wenke Transcriber's Notes: This manifest has been transcribed as seen, regardless of the spelling, abbreviation, punctuation or capitalization used by the recorder. Any exceptions are explained in these Transcriber's Notes. A question mark (?) indicates a word, number or letter that could not be deciphered with certainty due to the quality of the original document or handwriting of the recorder. An asterisk (*) indicates either difficulty in deciphering the handwriting of the manifest or something in the Transcriber's Notes to which the reader should refer. The transcriber numbers all the passengers consecutively 1 through 131, even though the recorder of the original manifest numbered the 1st Cabin passengers 1 through 8, the 2nd Cabin passengers 1 through 22 and the Steerage passengers 1 through 101. The entry "U.S. of America" in the native country and destination country columns is shortened to "U. States" for formatting reasons. 46 Native Country entry is possibly "Munchen". 55 Native Country entry is either "Tinkenbach" or "Finkenbach". 57-60 Native Country entry is possibly "Kissingen".

National Archives and Records Administration, Film M237, Reel 305, List 15.

Transcribed by Phil Buckley a member of the

Immigrant Ships Transcribers Guild

3 October 2019

or home page, please submit the following

information (as much of it as you have)

Name of the ship your ancestor arrived on

any other information you want to share
